text:
Hi Anirudh,

I came in touch with you through Eclub. I recall our time together in InterIIT tech meet 2018 at IIT B.  We had participated together in the Engineers conclave.  That day spent with you and Jay was really fun.  I was expecting you to continue in Eclub as a coordinator from Hall 5.   In 4th sem, we did our TA202 project and ESO203 lab together.  We did not connect much in 6th and 7th sem though. I am glad that I could connect with you again in 8th sem while collaborating on AML course project.  Hope that you will stay in touch. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Ankit,

I was fortunate to have you as my roommate in first year.  I remember that our room 324 and Ashok's bed in the middle was mostly occupied by Apurv who used to bring all the electronics stuff in our room.  We went through the ups and downs in our first-year courses together. I remember that your 1st sem endsem exams had got over before mine and I had two papers left but with a gap of 3-4 days.  You, me, and Ashok had watched around 7 movies together that night before my exam.   Some of them which I remember well are "Fantastic Beasts and where to find them", "The Arrival", "Lucy". I became so engrossed in having fun that night, I did not do any practice for TA101 lab exam and ended up with the only B grade in my first sem.  

We lost contact after our first year when both of us decided to change roommates.  Even our rooms were on the two extremes of 4 mid wing. I hope that you did well after your first year. Hope that we might connect sometime in the future. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Monika,

Our interaction was mostly limited to our second year when you were secy in Eclub. We had helped each other a lot in 3rd sem courses. I specifically remember that I used to be overloaded with many activities in 3rd sem. I and Soumya had a deadline of TIIDC challenge and we also had ESC201 quiz the next day. You had helped me that night by sharing some assignment solution and I could solve a similar question that appeared in the major quiz.  You might have saved my grade for ESC201!
Thanks for that.

Do you remember that we had jointly organized the surprise birthday party for Abhigyan!  You were among the active secys at that time. No doubt that they made you the prospective coordinator in winter camp. I was expecting that they make you coordinator too. 

We did not connect much after our second year.  Our paths might be very different now. Hope that you will stay in touch. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
You were one among the two "Prakhar"s whom I knew at IIT K.  Yes! The other one is Prakhar Srivastava whom I also met the first time at E club. 

One of my most exciting collaborations with you was participation in TIIDC in our second year. Although we didn't continue the project further, it was a memorable experience. One of the funniest parts was recording the video for the challenge. If you still have the video saved in your drive, please DM me the video. 

I recall the night before the E club coordi interview when we were brainstorming over the million dollar question of "How to keep track of the components in E club?"  Even after completing my tenure as coordinator, I haven't figured out a solution yet!   

During my tenure as coordi, many of my decisions were influenced by you in terms of deciding a project for club or purchasing any new component. Thanks for your ideas and support for Eclub.  Hope that our paths will cross in the future!  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Vakul,

Although we knew each other since first year,  our true bonding was during Prof. Ravichandran's course on "Literature and the individual" in 6th sem.  We shared many funny moments in TRC's class.  Although the course was left off-way (half-way) due to covid, we still managed to read the novel Hotel Silence by Auður Ava Ólafsdóttir and write a term paper.  Hope that you realized the purpose of your life after reading this novel and other short stories in the course.

Our paths might be very different now.  Hope that we will connect sometime in the future to relive the TRC chapter.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Jay,

Although we were a part of Eclub since our first year, I really felt connected to you during the period before coordi interviews.  I recall that we were given several tasks like club cleaning and bringing in new furniture. These were the first tasks that we did together as prospective coordinators (All thanks to Abhigyan who made us collectively do these tasks to build our bonding). 

You are the most creative person in our club. You were the face of Eclub managing the important role of publicity. Your poster designing skills are amazing.  I recall you taking a lot of effort to create the poster for the E4U initiative. Almost all posters and website designing were managed by you.  Your name will go down in history for redesigning the club website (https://students.iitk.ac.in/eclub/).   

Although our last meet was before covid pandemic started, we have been connecting virtually on various occasions. The last time we connected was for the Eclub coordi interview for Y19 batch. Hope that we will reunite some time in the near future. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Jaya,

You were one among the two "Jaya"s that I knew at IIT K. The other one is Jaya Srivastava from Y18.  I can see that you were a good student guide of Jaya Srivastava who also joined the E club one year after you.  

Opting for a double major in electrical was a good decision by you.  Hope that you will contact me again during the pre-registration for next semester. I will be happy to help you in deciding the elective courses.  

All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Kanishka, 

Thanks for being a part of my journey here.
We met first time in the E club winter camp. I recall that our first project together was creating an egg basket game in processing software where the basket was controlled using Arduino and ultrasonic sensors. We also made an application using Android Studio. 

I am amazed by your knowledge of places to visit on the campus. Before I met you, I was not aware of sites like the oxidation pond behind OAT and the IIT K nursery at the end of the road to the auditorium. 

I was glad that you continued in the E club after the summer project on Skin Track. We jointly conducted many events for the club. Even after your tenure as a secy was over, you remained in touch with club activities. I recall that you had borrowed the LED strip from the club to celebrate your friend's birthday. You are really good at organizing surprise birthday celebrations for your friends. I recall that you had planned my birthday celebration in the Lecture Hall complex in my third year (However, it was not a surprise for me since you had invited Apurv, who leaked the info about your planning)


Although we didn't do many courses together, the one course we did together was the ENG course by Prof Ravichandran on "Literature and the Individual." I recall that we had rehearsed the debate of Kafka's " The metamorphosis." The debate was supposed to be on the spot, but prof never realized that we had decided our points-counterpoints beforehand! 

It is great that you, too, have plans to pursue graduate studies in the US. I hope that we will meet sometime soon. I will be happy to help you with your grad school applications.
All the best for your thesis work here and all future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Karan,

I am glad to have collaborated with you in Eclub and ERA.  Do you remember my vision of "Umbrella organization" and the jokes that you, Soumya, Shobhit, and Naishadh used to make!
I also recall the TIIDC challenge. You and Soumya had accompanied me in finding a faculty mentor for TIIDC a day before the deadline.  We also managed to record the video and get free components from Texas Instruments.  Thanks for supporting me in this crazy endeavor. 

Our areas of interest may be quite different now. Hope that you will stay in touch. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Madhur,

We knew each other through SnT council. I had heard a lot about you from Jay.  We interacted mostly in the SnT council meets in Senate Hall. I recall that you had participated in the Electrowiz competition conducted by Eclub in senate hall. Your team was among the top-performing teams (mostly because many of the questions that I had set were from our common EE courses). Although we didn't collaborate much over any project, it was fun to jointly organize many events for SnT council.  I wish that we would have collaborated more with the Robo club.

Besides SnT council, we did our EMEC lab of EE381 together. In 8th sem, we also did Prof. AKJ's estimation and detection course together. Our areas of interest may be quite different now. Hope that our paths may cross sometime in the future. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Maitreyee,

Our interaction was mostly during your time in the ERA team. We both were working in the same sub-system and were assigned the task of understanding the mecanum wheel system and simulating it in ROS and Gazebo. I recall that we had also started recording videos for creating the lecture series on Arduino for ERA.  Later, you decided to quit ERA and pursue your interests in other areas.  Anyways, I hope that you were able to devote time to pursue your other interests and I hope that you did not regret quitting ERA. 

Our areas of interest are quite different now.  I hope that you will keep in touch.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Mudit, 

Our interaction started with collaborating on the problem statement by BARC in our first Techmeet at IIT B. Remember those nights that we spent together in Hall 12 sitting in front of PIR sensor. Some funny events that I recall during our presentation at IIT B was the cup of tea spilling on the judge which led to our team getting extra time for the presentation.  The best part was our chat on the messenger group with Suraj, Abhigyan, Ashok. Might go through the chat to relive the experience of Techmeet once again !

The next memorable part was our second trip to Mumbai for presenting the prototype to BARC. We were fortunate to have connected with our alumni Sumit Chowdhury who later met us in Hall 12 canteen during his visit to IIT K.

We were really hoping to get a gold medal for the Roorkee edition by BARC/ Alphonso.
Unfortunately, this event was a closed-door event and we missed all the fun that we had in Mumbai. 

We have been through ups and downs together in our Eclub journey. Thanks for always supporting me in my crazy visions for club. One last thing that we missed was our project on Crazyflie which had to be discontinued due to covid. Our batch will be remembered as the one which revolutionized the club. Not only did we bring in new initiatives, we also renovated the club and redesigned the club website. 

Your tenure as Gensec will also go down in history for bringing back the title of Techmeet winners. Hope that all four of us will have a chance of reunion some time in the future.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Naishadh,

Our interaction has been mostly limited to our second-year journey in ERA.  You were among the most hardworking members of our team.  Our entire third and fourth sem were entirely devoted to ERA.  We used to discuss the updates in the challenge even during EE250, EE210 lectures. We had jointly explored the area of reinforcement learning (although we did not use RL in the final submission).  We also shared many jokes together. Do you remember my vision for "Umbrella Organization"?

I was expecting you to apply for team-head in third year.  Anyways, neither of us pursued robotics after the third year. Our areas of interest are quite different now. Hope that you will stay in touch.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Nitesh,

Our names differ by only one vowel.  Many have accidentally referred to me as "Nitesh" in the past.  Thanks to the Counselling service that we ended up being in the same IITK family. If someone refers to me as "Nitesh" in the future, it will always remind me of you.  

You have been very helpful to me several times. In particular, I remember borrowing your bicycle many times when my bicycle was not in a proper shape. You used a weird chain lock on your cycle which was very heavy to carry around. 

In lecture halls, we have shared neighboring seats in all examinations of EE courses (In first-year Institute compulsory courses, Nitik had a seat between us).  You were always the first person with whom I discussed the exam paper.  Some of our exams were really bad ( Remember EE210 Endsem !)

I am fortunate that you used to borrow my notes before exams and create a scanned copy of those notes. Thanks for keeping a soft copy of my notes on your phone. These soft copies of my notes helped me later in 7th sem courses which required material from 5th sem courses (All my notebooks before 6th sem are still at the hostel room).

I will always cherish our friendship. Hope that our paths will cross again in the future. Stay in touch! All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Nupur,

Although our roll No differed by a single digit, we connected first time in TRC's course on "Literature and the individual" in 6th sem.  We shared many funny moments in TRC's class.  Although the course was left off-way (half-way) due to covid, we still managed to read the novel Hotel Silence by Auður Ava Ólafsdóttir and write a term paper.  Hope that you realized the purpose of your life after reading this novel and other short stories in the course.

Our paths might be very different now.  Hope that we will connect sometime in the future to relive the TRC chapter.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Prakhar,

I mainly connected with you during the INTER IIT Tech Meet.  BARC was a really memorable journey for us. I recall the time spent together sitting in front of the PIR Sensors.  We have been to Mumbai thrice for BARC. The first one was to IIT B in December 2018.  The second and third trip was to the BARC Mumbai office for presenting our prototype In May and August 2019.  Some funny events that I recall during our presentation at IIT B was the cup of tea spilling on the judge which led to our team getting extra time for the presentation.  The best part was our chat on the messenger group with Suraj, Abhigyan, Ashok. Might go through the chat to relive the experience of Techmeet once again ! We are fortunate to have connected with our alumni Sumit Chowdhury who later met us in Hall 12 canteen during his visit to IIT K.

It is great that you are pursuing double major in EE. I will be happy to share info about any of the courses that you plan to pursue in EE.  Keep in touch! All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Priyanshu,

You were the first person that I talked to in my first lecture (PHY102) on my first day in L20.  I am fortunate that I met you during my first year. We went through ups and downs in our first-year courses together. We have not contacted each other after your branch change from EE to CSE. I wish you could have continued in EE. We would definitely have had an amazing journey through EE courses together. Hope that you did well in academics after your branch change.  Our paths and areas of interest might be very different now.  Hope that we will connect sometime in the future.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Reithick,

It was great to collaborate with you on the RIS challenge.  We did a lot of common courses in our 7th and 8th sem.  It is great that you too have joined Prof. Rohit Budhiraja's WiSDOm group. Hopefully, our paths will cross again in the future too.   All the best for your thesis work in WiSDOm group.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Rohin,

You were among the two "Rohin"s that I knew at IIT K. The other one is my SG, Rohin Garg Y16 EE.

Most of our interaction was during the courses in EE. We have been through ups and downs together, helping each other through assignments and getting our doubts solved. I specifically recall EE370 and our interaction with Prof. Iyer.  You always had your lab sessions in EE381 before my labs. I used to call you every week before my lab to get the pre-lab sheet done.

Another reason I felt connected with you was that you lived in room 234 in your third year which also happens to be the room that I had lived in my second year.  Technically, I happen to be your bed-baap!

Although our areas of interest have diverged since 6th semester, I hope to stay in touch with you in the future. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Sandeep.  
Thanks for being a part of my IIT K journey.  I recall that we had first connected in the second year when we were allotted a common alumni buddy in the Alumni Buddy program. Although my alumni buddy did not connect with me, I am fortunate that I connected with you. 

We have completed numerous courses and course projects together for the last 1 year. I am fortunate that one of the term papers with you resulted in a publication [1] that was also our first conference paper.  You have influenced many of my decisions in the last year that helped me shape my academic interests and future plans.  I hope that our paths will cross again and we collaborate on some research problems at the intersection of our research interests.

All the best for your future endeavors.

[1]Spectral Efficiency in Poisson Cluster Based HetNets with Users-Basestations Correlation https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9342826
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Sathvik,

Remember the cab that we took from campus to the airport when we were going home for vacations in March 2020.   You had asked me whether we need to worry if our internships in the US will be affected because of covid.   At that time, covid had just reached India and we were still traveling without any mask.  Many things changed after that week.  We had received the mail from TAMU that our internships had been rescinded.  All our plans of spending time together at TAMU were ruined. If not for covid, I am sure that we would have connected really well.   Anyways, keep in touch. Our paths will definitely cross in the future.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Shashank, 

We first connected during the second-year summer during our projects with Prof Vipul Arora.  Although our project topics were different, we used to discuss the fundamental concepts related to audio processing and ML.  I am glad that you too were pursuing the project in Prof. Arora's group. Remember the discussions that we used to have in the library with the other two students from IIT B who had joined Prof. Arora's group as interns. Those group discussions really helped me in complete my project within the two months duration.

Our areas of interest may have diverged now.   I hope to stay in touch with you. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Shivam.

You were the coolest bhai in Rohin's family. I recall that in my first year, I did not explore the campus and Kanpur city that much. You and Rajat took me outside campus for the first time. You were also the first ones who took me to CCD.   


Do you remember that I used to approach you every year after midsem exams to borrow your harddisk which had a great collection of movies. I had copied the movies from your drive. I even have a folder named "Movies from Shivam" saved in my PC. I will remember you the most whenever I watch movies from your collection.

Although our courses were different, I recall that we had shared a few common courses like linear algebra and probability/statistics.  We both had missed B grade marginally in MSO201 class 

You were also among the academic mentors (AM) for PHY102. We both used to go to Hall 13 together to solve doubts in PHY102 for Y18.  I recall that for some mentoring sessions, hum dono ne sath me AM sessions se fraud mara tha.

Anyways, hope that we will connect again soon.


PS: Vaise Rohin se baap treat nahi mila na? Tum yaad dilaoge unko?
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Shivam,

I came in touch with you through Eclub.  I mostly knew you as Soumya's roommate. I used to visit your room often during the second year to discuss ERA work with Soumya. On the other hand, you used to visit my room to discuss IGVC work with Apurv.  It was a weird combination of ERA-IGVC roommates for both of us. We did not collaborate much in any Eclub project.  We collaborated in TA202 lab in 4th sem. 

Our paths might be very different now. I hope that you will keep in touch.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Shivam,

Our interaction was mostly limited to our first year.  We went through the ups and downs in our first-year courses together. Besides academics, we had participated together in Nukkad-Natak in our second semester in the Drams club. We were the only two who had participated from Hall 3.  

Our paths and areas of interest are very different now.  Hope that you will stay in touch. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Shobhit,

You are one of the coolest persons that I met in  Eclub. I am glad that I could collaborate with you in Eclub and ERA.  Our participation in TIIDC was memorable.  The funniest part was recording a video for TIIDC.  Do you remember my vision of "Umbrella organization" and the jokes that you, Karan, Soumya, Naishadh used to make !!

Apart from Eclub and ERA, we had also shared the common HSS course on Literature by Prof Neelkanthan.  It was great to see you perform role-play during his class. 

Our areas of interest may have diverged now. I hope that you will stay in touch.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Soumya, 

I am glad that I met you at IIT K in our second year.  We have been through several ups and downs together (especially third sem and fourth sem).  We connected first time through Eclub.  Remember the time when ERA was being founded. Most of our time together in second year was spent in Prof Behera's lab, EClub and later at Hall 12 ERA room / Suraj's room.

We had also collaborated in TIIDC. You had accompanied me in finding a faculty mentor the day before deadline. The funniest part of TIIDC was recording the video.  You have supported me in all of my crazy ventures. 

The one unique thing that you taught me was sending GIFs on Facebook messenger. Our chat is full of GIFs.

You really manage your time well. You took several leadership roles simultaneously in SnT council. You led several problem statements
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Soumya,

I am glad that I met you at IIT K in our second year. We have been through several ups and downs together (especially third sem and fourth sem). We connected first time through Eclub. Remember the time when ERA was being founded. Most of our time together in second year was spent in Prof Behera's lab, EClub and later at Hall 12 ERA room / Suraj's room.

We had also collaborated in TIIDC. You had accompanied me in finding a faculty mentor the day before deadline. The funniest part of TIIDC was recording the video. You have supported me in all of my crazy ventures.
Another crazy venture was a blog written from the interview with Prof Venkatesh. 


The one unique thing that you taught me was sending GIFs on Facebook messenger. Our chat is full of GIFs.

You really manage your time well. You took several leadership roles simultaneously in SnT council. You led several problem statements at INTER IIT 8 and 9 and brought glory to Eclub, SnT council and IIT K. Continue to inspire the future generation of SnT council !

We will continue to connect with each other especially on occasions related to club and council.  Hope that all four of us will get a chance to reunite some time in the future.

All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Sunamya,

 We connected first time in TRC's course on "Literature and the individual" in 6th sem.  We shared many funny moments in TRC's class.  Although the course was left off-way (half-way) due to covid, we still managed to read the novel Hotel Silence by Auður Ava Ólafsdóttir and write a term paper.  Hope that you realized the purpose of your life after reading this novel and other short stories in the course.

Our paths might be very different now.  Hope that we will connect sometime in the future to relive the TRC chapter.  All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Tarish,

You are among the one at IIT K whom I know the longest.  We know each other since class 8. We were together for the Young Scientist exam coaching class by Kotwal ma'am. After that, we joined Vidyalankar for Physics Olympiad classes.  Are you in touch with our mutual friends from Vidyalankar? 

You were the coordinator of the coolest club in SnT council. I remember the night that I spent in Astro club when collaborating for a SnT council proposal.
Thanks for allowing Eclub to conduct one of our secys meets at Astro club.
I wish that I could have spent more time at Astro Club.

It is great that you pursued your liking towards Physics and Astronomy at IIT K. I recall that you had medals in Astronomy Olympiads before joining college. Although I don't know much about astronomy, radio astronomy sounds cool as it has a bit of intersection with electrical engineering. I recall that you too, had collaborated with the Microwave lab in EE for one of your projects. 

Physics and electrical engineering have a good amount of intersection. Hopefully, our paths might cross again in the future.

If you are in Thane, we might meet up sometime.

All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande

text:
Hi Tushar,

I hope that you recall our first project together. The "Smart Dustbin" is still in my room at Hall 3.  Could you share the Youtube link of the video that we made for presenting our Smart Dustbin in Eclub winter camp?  We had also won an RPI0  which is still at Eclub.  I enjoyed the time that I spent with you, Anshul, and your other Bhai's. Sometimes, I envy you that Abhigyan was your bapu.  We later also did the FPGA project in summers.  

We did not interact much after our first year. Hope that I get a chance to connect with you, Anshul, your bhais and Abhigyan sometime in the future. All the best for your future endeavors.
author: Nitish Vikas Deshpande
